page.title: 05Local Place-names:Kielder
page.content: In the area around Kielder, in this part of Northumberland, there is a rich store of strange-sounding place-names.The derivation of some of these is presented below: {Burn}: hill stream {Cleugh}: steep-sided valley {Haugh}: flat fertile land beside a river {Kielder}: a violent stream {Knowe}: small rounded hill {Moss} : peat bog {Pike} : prominent pointed hill {Rigg} : ridge of a hill {Shaw }: wood {Shiel}: upland summer grazing {Sike} : ditch or small stream {Spout}: waterfall {Stell}: sheepfold
